topic.title: Direct Runoff in SWR: Surface-Water Routing Process

para.text: Direct Runoff in SWR: Surface-Water Routing Process
Direct Runoff in SWR: Surface-Water Routing Process
are explained in the help for the

: DROMAP2D defines the mapping of each cell to a specific SWR1 reach. This array is initialized to have values equal to 0, as a result, direct runoff would not be routed to SWR1 reaches until DROMAP2D values between 1 and the total number of reaches are specified. Direct runoff is not routed for cells having DROMAP2D values less than 1 or greater than the total number of reaches.

: DROVAL2D defines the base direct runoff rate to apply. This array is initialized to have values equal to 0, as a result, direct runoff would not be routed to SWR1 reaches defined by DROMAP2D values until DROMAP2D values between 1 and the total number of reaches are specified. Direct runoff has units of L/T.
